Glossary

Term Definition
Carbon Footprint The total amount of greenhouse gases emitted directly or indirectly by an individual, organisation, or product.
Circular Economy An economic system aimed at eliminating waste and continually reusing resources through repair, recycling, and regeneration.
Digital Inclusion Ensuring equal access to digital technologies and opportunities for all people, regardless of background or ability.
Digital Sustainability The practice of using digital technologies and resources in ways that support environmental protection, social well-being, and long-term economic viability.
E-Waste (Electronic Waste) Discarded electrical or electronic devices that require proper recycling to prevent environmental harm.
ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) A framework for evaluating a company’s impact on sustainability through environmental performance, social responsibility, and ethical governance.
Green IT Environmentally responsible computing that focuses on reducing the carbon footprint and energy consumption of ICT systems.
Hybrid Work A flexible work model combining remote and on-site work, often supported by digital technologies to enhance collaboration and sustainability.
Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) A method for evaluating the environmental impact of a product or service throughout its entire life cycle—from production to disposal.
Responsible Innovation Designing and implementing technology solutions that are ethical, inclusive, and aligned with sustainable values.
SDGs (Sustainable Development Goals) A set of 17 global goals adopted by the United Nations to promote sustainable development and equality by 2030.
Stakeholder Engagement The process of involving individuals or groups affected by an organisation’s actions in decision-making and sustainability initiatives.
Sustainability Reporting The process of measuring, disclosing, and being accountable for organisational performance toward sustainable goals.
